Weather forecast

This component demonstrates fetching data from the server.

Created Modified First Name Last Name Phone Actions
{{ contact.dateCreated }} {{ contact.dateModified }} {{ contact.firstName }} {{ contact.lastName }} {{ contact.phoneNumber }}
import { Component, Inject } from '@angular/core'; import { HttpClient } from '@angular/common/http'; @Component({ selector: 'app-fetch-data', templateUrl: './fetch-data.component.html' }) export class FetchDataComponent { public contacts: Contacts[] = []; constructor( private http: HttpClient, @Inject('BASE_URL') private baseUrl: string ) { this.loadContacts(); } loadContacts(): void { this.http.get(this.baseUrl + 'weatherforecast').subscribe(result => { this.contacts = result; }, error => console.error(error)); } editItem(contact: any): void { // Navigate to the new component for editing // You can use the Angular Router for navigation // Example: this.router.navigate(['/edit', contact.id]); } deleteItem(contact: any): void { // Make an API call to delete the item // Example: this.http.delete(`/api/contacts/${contact.id}`).subscribe(() => { /* handle success */ }); } } interface Contacts { dateCreated: string; dateModified: string; firstName: string; lastName: string; phoneNumber: string; }
